intro: Fumaria bastardii var. benedicta, commonly known as the blessed fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces elongated, slender seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
